description: Borrowed from Italian pasticcio. Doublet of pastiche.

examples: On our first entrance into the palace, which is a pasticcio of Saracenic, Conventual, and Grecian architecture, I was much taken with the principal front of the inner-court; a piece of as good Morisco work as any I had yet seen.

entries.meaning: (art) An artwork that directly imitates the work of another artist or artists.
(art) A falsified work of art, such as a vase or statue made up of parts of original works, with missing parts supplied.
